isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB AIR RIDE (9200/9300/9400 MODELS WITH PRO SLEEPER, BEFORE MAY 1997)

svcproc.title: CAB AIR RIDE (9200/9300/9400 MODELS WITH PRO SLEEPER, BEFORE MAY 1997)

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 81 for Items in parentheses.

figure.caption: Figure 81. 92/93/9400 With Pro Sleeper (Before May 1997) Cab Air Ride

calloutgroup.callout1: 6. HEX SCREW AND WASHER, 5/16-18 UNC X 1

svcprocinfo.para: The cab air ride system for the 9200, 9300 and 9400 models with Pro Sleeper (before May 1997) contains two air springs (bags) (Item 5), two shock absorbers (Items 3 and 4), and is controlled by the cab air ride valve (Item 24). The air ride components are not interchangeable with different cab models.

The following components - air lines (Items 27 and 35), fittings (Items 26, 33 and 34), air springs (Item 5), cab air ride valve (Item 24), shock absorbers (Items 3 and 4) and track bar rod (Item 12) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve, air springs (bags) and shock absorbers are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para: Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and connections ( Figure 81). Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of components.

caution.para: If the cab has to be jacked up (lifted) for service of air ride components, it is recommended that the hood assembly be tilted to the fully open position and supported on an appropriate floor stand. This will eliminate any possible damage to the hood.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Valve - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 74 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: WARNING- To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

step1.para: Disconnect the air line connection (Item 8) from the cab air ride valve (Item 1).
Disconnect the horizontal adjuster rod (Item 6) from cab air ride valve (Item 1).
Remove the cab air ride valve ( Item 24, Figure 81) from the track bar mount bracket by removing bolts (Item 7).
Install the cab air ride valve and secure it to the track bar mount bracket with the mounting bolts. Tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 Nm).
Connect the air line connection to the cab air ride valve.
Turn the valve so the dot (mark) on the face of the rotating selector is in the down position ( Figure 75).

Install horizontal adjuster rod onto the cab air ride valve. Be sure the horizontal adjuster rod is properly seated into the cab air ride valve before tightening valve adjuster rod lock bolt (vertical adjuster rod is perpendicular).
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab height between the bottom of the upper mounting plate and the top of the lower mounting plate crossmember. Cab air suspension ride height is 7-3/4 inches ( Figure 76). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM (9200/9300/9400 MODELS WITH PRO SLEEPER, BEFORE MAY 1997).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Shock Absorber - Remove

step1.para: Open hood to full tilt position.

caution.para: If the cab has to be jacked up (lifted) for service of air ride components, it is recommended that the hood assembly be tilted to the fully open position and supported on an appropriate floor stand. This will eliminate any possible damage to the hood.

step1.para: Use a suitable jack placed on frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame ( Figure 77).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 81 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Raise cab for enough clearance to remove shock absorbers (Items 3 and 4).

caution.para: Over-raising of cab may cause component damage.

step1.para: Remove hex head screws and washers (Item 6) at the top of the shock absorber (Item 3).

Remove shock absorber (Item 3) with cushion and retainer (Items 37 and 38) by removing jam nut and hex nut (Items 39 and 32), and retainer and cushion (Items 38 and 37) at the bottom of the shock absorber.
Remove hex head screws and washers (Item 6) at the top of the shock absorber (Item 4).
Remove shock absorber (Item 4) with washer and spacer (Items 2 and 1) by removing hex nut and washer (Items 32 and 2) at the bottom of the shock absorber.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Shock Absorber - Install

step1.para: Position shock absorber with washer and spacer in place at cab lower mounting bracket and install washer and hex nut. Then install hex head screws and washers at the cab upper mounting bracket. Tighten hex nut to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 Nm).

Position shock absorber with retainer and cushion in place at cab lower mounting bracket. Make sure small end of cushion is in the shock mount of the cab lower mounting bracket, then position another cushion and retainer in place under the cab lower mounting bracket. Make sure small end of cushion is in the shock mount of the cab lower mounting bracket, and install hex nut. Tighten to 10 to 15 ft-lbs. (14 to 20 Nm).
Install jam nut and tighten against the hex nut.
Position top of shock absorber in place at the cab upper mounting bracket and install hex head screws and washers.
Release jack and lower cab.
Close and latch hood.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Air Spring (Bag) - Remove

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

step1.para: Open hood to full tilt position.

caution.para: If the cab has to be jacked up (lifted) for service of air ride components, it is recommended that the hood assembly be tilted to the fully open position and supported on an appropriate floor stand. This will eliminate any possible damage to the hood.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 81 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove the air lines (Items 27 and 35) and fittings (Items 33 and 34) from the bottom of the air springs (bags) (Item 5).
Remove the push-on ring (Item 7) at the top and bottom stud of the air springs (bags) (Item 5).
Use a suitable jack placed on frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame ( Figure 77).
Raise cab for enough clearance to remove air springs (bags) (Item 5).

caution.para: Over-raising of cab may cause component damage.

step1.para: Remove the air springs (bags) (Item 5) from between the cab upper mounting bracket (Item 8) and the cab lower mounting bracket (Item 25).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Air Spring (Bag) - Install

step1.para: Position the air springs (bags) in place between the cab upper mounting bracket and the cab lower mounting bracket.
Release jack and lower cab.
Secure the air springs (bags) with the push-on ring at the top and bottom stud of the air springs (bags). Securely press on studs, top and bottom.
Install the air lines and fittings at the bottom of the air springs (bags).
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.
Close and latch hood.

Check cab height between the bottom of the cab upper mounting bracket and the top of the cab lower mounting bracket crossmember ( Figure 76). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM (9200/9300/9400 MODELS WITH PRO SLEEPER, BEFORE MAY 1997).
